ground_truth: Graham's silver station wagon drives along the freeway and passes a large modern church. The station wagon parks beside other vehicles outside a parade of shops, and the family gets out. Merrill feeds the parking meter, and Morgan holds his hand out to Graham. Graham hands Morgan some cash, and Morgan and Bo head off down the sidewalk together. Graham watches them as Morgan holds out his hand and Bo takes it. Graham turns and calls to Merrill, who strolls off in the other direction. Morgan is in a bookshop watching the news coverage with the middle-aged proprietors, while Graham waits at the counter in a pharmacy listening to a radio. The young shop assistant comes to the counter with a paper prescription bag and leans pensively on the counter. Tracy's face crumples, and Graham looks awkward. Meanwhile, Merrill is in an army recruitment center looking at posters where a gray-haired man in a sergeant's uniform sits at a desk with a poster of Uncle Sam behind him. Merrill turns to the sergeant, and Cunningham stares up at Merrill. Merrill gazes apprehensively down at Cunningham, then laughs. Cunningham gives Merrill a pamphlet, and Merrill stares at Cunningham, then nods. A scruffy young man is filling out a form. Lionel smirks, with stubble on his chin and wearing a t-shirt and sleeveless biker jacket. Merrill folds up the pamphlet and puts it in his pocket, then walks solemnly towards the door. He stops just behind Lionel and jerks as though about to hit him, causing Lionel to flinch, and then Merrill leaves. In the bookshop, Bo sits at a table and sips a glass of water as a cola commercial comes on TV. Morgan holds the book out to the lady. Meanwhile, in the pharmacy, Tracy thinks. Merrill, Morgan, and Bo are already eating in a pizza restaurant when Graham comes in and sits at their table. The other three nod, and Graham sighs and nods back, then glances out of the restaurant doorway. His expression hardens when he sees a young dark-haired man of Asian descent strolling down the sidewalk and opening the back door of a brown Chevrolet four by four. Morgan follows his father's gaze and looks out of the doorway at the man, and Merrill also gazes out at the young man. Graham and his family stare fixedly out at the young man, who shuts his car door and glances over at the restaurant, seeing the family gazing back at him. His mouth opens in surprise as Graham takes a deep breath. The young man looks unsettled as he gets into his driver's seat, fires up the engine, and the four by four swings out of its parking bay and accelerates off down the road. Graham turns back to the table and takes a bite of pizza, while Merrill, Morgan, and Bo continue looking out at the street.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Graham's argent station automobile maneuvers along the highway and overtakes a sizable contemporary chapel. The station vehicle halts beside other automobiles outside a procession of stores, and the household exits. Merrill nourishes the parking meter, and Morgan extends his hand to Graham. Graham gives Morgan some money, and Morgan and Bo head off down the pavement together. Graham observes them as Morgan extends his hand and Bo grips it. Graham rotates and calls to Merrill, who saunters off in the opposite direction. Morgan is in a bookstore viewing the news broadcast with the middle-aged owners, while Graham waits at the counter in a drugstore listening to a radio. The youthful shop clerk approaches the counter with a paper prescription sack and reclines thoughtfully on the counter. Tracy's visage crumples, and Graham appears uneasy. Meanwhile, Merrill is in a military enlistment center looking at posters where a gray-haired man in a sergeant's attire sits at a desk with a poster of Uncle Sam behind him. Merrill turns to the sergeant, and Cunningham gazes up at Merrill. Merrill peers anxiously down at Cunningham, then chuckles. Cunningham offers Merrill a brochure, and Merrill gazes at Cunningham, then acknowledges. A shabby young man is completing a form. Lionel grins, with stubble on his chin and wearing a t-shirt and sleeveless biker vest. Merrill folds up the brochure and places it in his pocket, then strides solemnly towards the door. He pauses just behind Lionel and jerks as if about to strike him, causing Lionel to recoil, and then Merrill departs. In the bookstore, Bo sits at a table and sips a glass of water as a soda advertisement appears on TV. Morgan extends the book to the woman. Meanwhile, in the drugstore, Tracy contemplates. Merrill, Morgan, and Bo are already dining in a pizza eatery when Graham enters and sits at their table. The other three acknowledge, and Graham exhales and acknowledges back, then peeks out of the eatery entryway. His demeanor hardens when he notices a youthful dark-haired man of Asian heritage ambling down the pavement and opening the back door of a brown Chevrolet four by four. Morgan follows his father's gaze and looks out of the entryway at the man, and Merrill also gazes out at the young man. Graham and his family stare intently out at the young man, who shuts his automobile door and glances over at the eatery, seeing the family staring back at him. His mouth opens in astonishment as Graham inhales deeply. The young man appears perturbed as he gets into his driver's seat, starts up the engine, and the four by four swings out of its parking space and speeds off down the street. Graham turns back to the table and takes a bite of pizza, while Merrill, Morgan, and Bo continue looking out at the roadway.

Other vehicles outside a parade of shops are parked beside by the station wagon, and the family gets out. The parking meter is fed by Merrill, and his hand is held out by Morgan to Graham. Meanwhile, posters in an army recruitment center are looked at by Merrill, where a gray-haired man in a sergeant's uniform sits at a desk with a poster of Uncle Sam behind him. The sergeant is turned to by Merrill, and Cunningham stares up at him. Merrill gazes apprehensively down at Cunningham, then he laughs. Just behind Lionel he stops and jerks as though about to hit Lionel, causing him to flinch, and then Merrill leaves. In the bookshop, a table is sat at by Bo and a glass of water is sipped by her as a cola commercial comes on TV. The book is held out to the lady by Morgan. Meanwhile, in the pharmacy, a thought crosses Tracy's mind. A pizza restaurant is already being eaten in by Merrill, Morgan, and Bo when Graham comes in and sits at their table. The other three nod, and a sigh is let out by Graham and he nods back, then the restaurant doorway is glanced out of by him. His expression hardens when the young dark-haired man of Asian descent is seen strolling down the sidewalk and opening the back door of a brown Chevrolet four by four. Morgan follows his father's gaze and looks out of the doorway at the man, and the young man is also gazed out at by Merrill. Graham and his family stare fixedly out at the young man, who shuts his car door and glances over at the restaurant, seeing the family gazing back at him. His mouth opens in surprise as a deep breath is taken by Graham. The young man looks unsettled as he gets into his driver's seat, fires up the engine, and the four by four is swung out of its parking bay and off down the road it accelerates. The table is turned back to by Graham and a bite of pizza is taken by him, while the street is continued to be looked out at by Merrill, Morgan, and Bo.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Graham's silver station wagon drives along the freeway and parks outside a parade of shops. The family exits; Merrill feeds the parking meter, and Graham gives Morgan cash. Morgan and Bo walk down the sidewalk hand in hand. Graham calls to Merrill, who heads the opposite way. In a bookshop, Morgan watches the news with owners. Graham waits at a pharmacy counter listening to the radio. The young assistant hands him a prescription bag, looking pensive, while Tracy's face crumples awkwardly. Meanwhile, Merrill is at an army recruitment center, viewing posters with a sergeant. After receiving a pamphlet from the sergeant, Merrill leaves, jerking at a young man named Lionel, causing him to flinch. In the bookshop, Bo sips water as Morgan hands a lady a book. Later, at a pizza restaurant, Graham joins his family at the table and sighs, glancing out the doorway. His expression hardens at seeing a young Asian man entering a Chevrolet four by four. The man notices their gaze, looks surprised, and drives off. Graham takes a bite of pizza, while Merrill, Morgan, and Bo continue staring out at the street.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Graham's silver station wagon drives along the freeway, passing a large church, and parks near shops. The family gets out; Merrill feeds the meter, and Morgan asks Graham for cash. Morgan and Bo walk down the sidewalk, holding hands. Graham calls to Merrill, who leaves in the opposite direction. Morgan watches news in a bookshop while Graham waits at a pharmacy with a radio. A young shop assistant leans on the counter with a prescription bag; Tracy looks pensive, and Graham appears awkward. Merrill visits an army recruitment center, interacts with Sergeant Cunningham, receives a pamphlet, and pretends to hit Lionel, a scruffy young man. Bo sips water in a bookshop as a cola ad plays; Morgan holds a book. In a pizza place with Merrill, Morgan, and Bo, Graham's expression changes seeing a young Asian man in a brown Chevrolet. The family stares as he notices them and drives away. Graham turns back to the table and eats pizza, while the others keep watching the street.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Graham's sleek silver station wagon smoothly cruises along the busy freeway, effortlessly passing by a large, modern church that stands as an imposing structure against the skyline. Eventually, the station wagon maneuvers into a parking spot alongside a line of other parked vehicles outside a parade of bustling shops, and the family gracefully exits the vehicle. Merrill diligently feeds coins into the parking meter, ensuring that their time is well accounted for, while young Morgan eagerly extends his hand toward Graham. In response, Graham hands Morgan a small wad of cash, which Morgan readily accepts, and then he and Bo head off together down the sidewalk, their steps in sync. Graham lingers for a moment, watching them as Morgan once again offers his hand, and Bo readily grasps it, solidifying their bond. Graham then turns his attention and calls out to Merrill, who leisurely strolls off in the opposite direction.

Inside the inviting bookshop, Morgan stands intently watching the news coverage alongside the middle-aged proprietors, their eyes glued to the screen. Meanwhile, in a nearby pharmacy, Graham stands patiently at the counter, listening intently to the crackling voice on the radio. A young shop assistant approaches the counter with a small paper prescription bag in hand and leans pensively against it. Tracy's face crumples with emotion, and Graham finds himself feeling awkward and uncertain in the moment. Elsewhere, Merrill finds himself situated in an army recruitment center, thoughtfully examining the posters on display, while a gray-haired man in a sergeant's uniform sits authoritatively at a desk, with a prominent poster of Uncle Sam looming behind him. Merrill looks down at the sergeant apprehensively, and Cunningham, the sergeant, gazes up at Merrill, their eyes meeting in a moment of shared understanding. Suddenly, Merrill breaks the tension with a laugh, and Cunningham responds by handing him a recruitment pamphlet. Merrill stares at Cunningham, nodding in acknowledgment before folding up the pamphlet and tucking it safely in his pocket. As he turns to leave, he pauses just behind a scruffy young man filling out a form, sporting stubble on his chin and clad in a t-shirt with a sleeveless biker jacket. With a sudden, jerking motion, Merrill pretends to hit the young man, causing Lionel to flinch instinctively, and then Merrill exits the room.

Back in the cozy bookshop, Bo sits contentedly at a small table, sipping on a refreshing glass of water as a cola commercial flickers onto the TV screen. Morgan, meanwhile, extends a book outward, offering it to the lady. Meanwhile, in the pharmacy, Tracy remains lost in thought. Later, Merrill, Morgan, and Bo are already seated and enjoying a meal in a pizza restaurant when Graham arrives and joins them at their table. The other three family members nod in acknowledgment of his arrival, and Graham responds with a sigh, nodding back in a shared understanding, before casting his gaze out through the restaurant's open doorway. His expression shifts, hardening as he spots a young, dark-haired man of Asian descent casually strolling down the sidewalk. The man approaches a brown Chevrolet four by four parked nearby, opening its back door with ease. Morgan follows his father's line of sight, peering out of the doorway at the man, and Merrill also turns his gaze outward toward the young man. The family continues to stare intently at the young man as he shuts the vehicle's door, pausing momentarily to glance over at the restaurant, catching sight of the family watching him. His mouth falls open in surprise as Graham draws in a deep breath, clearly focused on the situation. The young man appears momentarily unsettled as he slips into the driver's seat, starts the engine with a low rumble, and the four by four smoothly swings out of its parking spot, accelerating swiftly down the road. Graham then turns his attention back to the table and takes a deliberate bite of pizza, while Merrill, Morgan, and Bo persist in looking out toward the street, their attention still captivated by the unfolding scene.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Graham's sleek silver station wagon glides effortlessly along the bustling freeway, seamlessly passing by a large, modern church that stands prominently as an imposing architectural masterpiece against the expansive skyline. After a while, the station wagon skillfully maneuvers into an available parking spot, aligning itself alongside a row of other parked vehicles situated outside a bustling parade of vibrant shops. Gracefully, the family exits the vehicle, each member moving with a sense of purpose. Merrill, with careful attention to detail, feeds coins into the parking meter, making sure their stay is properly timed and well accounted for. Meanwhile, young Morgan eagerly stretches out his hand towards Graham. In response to this gesture, Graham hands Morgan a small wad of cash. Morgan readily accepts the money, and with that, he and Bo head off together down the sidewalk, their steps perfectly in sync with one another. Graham lingers for just a moment, watching them as Morgan once more offers his hand, which Bo promptly grasps, further solidifying their bond. Graham then shifts his focus and calls out to Merrill, who leisurely strolls off in the opposite direction, setting off on his own path.

Inside the welcoming and inviting bookshop, Morgan stands with focused intensity, watching the news coverage unfold alongside the middle-aged proprietors, all eyes glued to the captivating images on the screen. Meanwhile, not too far away in a nearby pharmacy, Graham stands patiently at the counter, listening intently to the crackling voice emanating from the radio. A young shop assistant approaches the counter, holding a small paper prescription bag in hand and leaning pensively against the counter. Tracy's face crumples with raw emotion, and Graham finds himself feeling somewhat awkward and uncertain in the midst of the moment. Elsewhere, Merrill finds himself situated within an army recruitment center, thoughtfully examining the posters that are prominently displayed on the walls. A gray-haired man, wearing a sergeant's uniform, sits with authority at a desk, a large and prominent poster of Uncle Sam looming behind him. Merrill looks down at the sergeant apprehensively, while Cunningham, the sergeant, gazes up at Merrill, their eyes meeting in a moment of mutual understanding. Suddenly, Merrill breaks the tension with a spontaneous laugh, and Cunningham responds by handing him a recruitment pamphlet. Merrill looks intently at Cunningham, nodding in acknowledgment before carefully folding up the pamphlet and securely tucking it into his pocket. As he turns to leave, he pauses momentarily just behind a scruffy young man who is diligently filling out a form, sporting stubble on his chin and clad in a casual t-shirt topped with a sleeveless biker jacket. With a sudden, jerking motion, Merrill playfully pretends to hit the young man, causing Lionel to flinch instinctively. With that, Merrill exits the room with a light-hearted stride.

Returning to the cozy bookshop, Bo sits contentedly at a small table, sipping on a refreshing glass of water while a lively cola commercial flickers onto the TV screen in the background. Meanwhile, Morgan extends a book outward, offering it to the lady present. At the same time, in the pharmacy, Tracy remains lost in her thoughts. Later, Merrill, Morgan, and Bo find themselves already seated and enjoying a meal in a bustling pizza restaurant when Graham arrives and joins them at their table. The other three family members nod in acknowledgment of his arrival, and Graham responds with a sigh, nodding back in a shared understanding, before casting his gaze thoughtfully out through the restaurant's open doorway. His expression shifts subtly, hardening as he observes a young, dark-haired man of Asian descent casually strolling down the sidewalk. The man approaches a nearby parked brown Chevrolet four-by-four, opening its back door with ease. Morgan follows his father's line of sight, peering out of the doorway at the man, and Merrill also turns his gaze outward, focusing on the young man. The family continues to stare with intense curiosity at the young man as he shuts the vehicle's door, pausing momentarily to glance over at the restaurant. He catches sight of the family quietly watching him, and his mouth falls open slightly in surprise as Graham draws in a deep, focused breath, clearly intent on understanding the situation. The young man appears momentarily unsettled as he slips into the driver's seat, starting the engine with a low rumble. The four-by-four smoothly swings out of its parking spot and accelerates swiftly down the road, making a quick exit from the scene. Graham then turns his attention back to the table, taking a deliberate bite of pizza, while Merrill, Morgan, and Bo persist in looking out toward the street, their attention still captivated by the unfolding scene.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Graham skillfully maneuvers his silver station wagon along the freeway, the vehicle gliding past a large modern church, its sleek structure reflecting the sunlight. As the station wagon arrives at a parade of shops, it finds a parking spot beside other neatly parked vehicles and comes to a smooth stop. The family members inside begin to disembark, opening the doors and stepping out into the open air. Merrill approaches the parking meter, reaching into his pocket to retrieve some change and carefully inserting the coins one by one. Meanwhile, Morgan extends his hand toward Graham, who promptly reaches into his wallet, drawing out some cash and handing it to Morgan. With the money in hand, Morgan and Bo set off down the sidewalk together, their steps in sync. Graham watches them closely as he notices Morgan stretching his hand out toward Bo, who eagerly takes it, their fingers interlocking. Turning his attention away from them, Graham calls out to Merrill, who begins to stroll leisurely in the opposite direction, taking his own path. Inside a nearby bookshop, Morgan becomes engrossed in the news coverage playing on a television, while he stands among the middle-aged proprietors who are absorbed in the unfolding events. Concurrently, Graham waits patiently at the counter of a pharmacy, his ears attuned to the radio's broadcast. The young shop assistant approaches Graham, cradling a paper prescription bag and leaning pensively on the counter, which evokes a sense of awkwardness from Graham as Tracy's face crumples under the weight of her thoughts. Meanwhile, Merrill finds himself within the walls of an army recruitment center, his eyes scanning the posters that adorn the room. A gray-haired man, donned in a sergeant's uniform, occupies a desk with an emblematic poster of Uncle Sam as his backdrop. Merrill turns toward the sergeant, and Cunningham, the man behind the desk, looks up at Merrill, their eyes meeting. Merrill's apprehensive gaze softens into laughter, and Cunningham offers him a pamphlet. Merrill accepts it, studying Cunningham for a moment before nodding in acknowledgment. Nearby, a scruffy young man is diligently filling out a form. Lionel, with stubble marking his chin and dressed in a t-shirt under a sleeveless biker jacket, smirks. Merrill carefully folds the pamphlet, tucking it into his pocket, and strides solemnly toward the exit. As he passes behind Lionel, he makes a sudden jerking motion as though about to strike, prompting Lionel to flinch instinctively. Satisfied, Merrill exits, leaving an air of tension behind. In the bookshop, Bo sits calmly at a table, sipping water from a glass while a cola commercial flashes across the TV screen. Morgan, holding a book, presents it to the lady at the counter. Meanwhile, in the pharmacy, Tracy is lost in thought. In a pizza restaurant, Merrill, Morgan, and Bo have already settled in, savoring their meal when Graham enters, joining them at the table. The three of them nod in recognition, and Graham reciprocates with a sigh and a nod, his gaze wandering toward the restaurant's doorway. His expression shifts, hardening as he spies a young dark-haired man of Asian descent casually strolling along the sidewalk. The man reaches the back door of a parked brown Chevrolet four by four and opens it. Intrigued, Morgan follows his father's gaze, peering out of the doorway, and soon Merrill's attention also turns toward the young man. The family watches the figure intently as he shuts the car door, momentarily glancing over at the restaurant to find the family observing him. Caught off guard, his mouth drops open in surprise while Graham inhales deeply. Unsettled, the young man climbs into the driver's seat, starts the engine, and the four by four gracefully exits its parking spot and accelerates down the road. Returning to the table, Graham resumes eating, taking a bite of pizza as Merrill, Morgan, and Bo continue their vigil, looking out at the street beyond.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Graham's silver station wagon drives along the freeway, passing a large modern church, before parking beside shops where the family disembarks. Merrill feeds the parking meter as Graham hands Morgan some cash, and Morgan and Bo head down the sidewalk hand in hand. Graham calls to Merrill as he strolls in the opposite direction. Morgan is in a bookshop watching the news with the proprietors, while Graham waits at a pharmacy counter listening to the radio. The shop assistant hands Graham a prescription bag, looking pensive. Meanwhile, Merrill is in an army recruitment center examining a poster when he interacts with Sergeant Cunningham, who gives him a pamphlet. After a brief exchange with a scruffy young man named Lionel, Merrill puts the pamphlet in his pocket and heads out. In the bookshop, Bo sips water as a TV commercial plays, and Morgan holds a book out to the lady. Later, Graham joins Merrill, Morgan, and Bo in a pizza restaurant. They nod at each other as Graham glances outside, noticing a young Asian man opening a car door. The family watches him with a fixed gaze until the man, unsettled by their stare, drives off. Graham then turns back to the table and takes a bite of pizza, while the others continue to look out at the street.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Graham's silver station wagon, a reliable vehicle known for its spacious interior and family-friendly design, drives along the freeway and passes a large modern church, a community landmark built a decade ago that hosts numerous social events. The station wagon parks beside other vehicles outside a parade of shops, a popular local spot featuring a mix of boutique stores and cafes, and the family gets out. Merrill feeds the parking meter, a common practice in this area known for its strict parking regulations, and Morgan holds his hand out to Graham. Graham hands Morgan some cash, and Morgan and Bo head off down the sidewalk together, passing by a well-known bakery famous for its apple pies. Graham watches them as Morgan holds out his hand and Bo takes it, a gesture reflecting their close sibling bond. Graham turns and calls to Merrill, who strolls off in the other direction, towards the town's historic clock tower. Morgan is in a bookshop, part of a small chain renowned for its eclectic collection, watching the news coverage with the middle-aged proprietors, long-time residents of the neighborhood, while Graham waits at the counter in a pharmacy, a staple in the community for over 20 years, listening to a radio broadcasting the latest local news. The young shop assistant comes to the counter with a paper prescription bag and leans pensively on the counter, her mind occupied with thoughts of her upcoming college applications. Tracy's face crumples, and Graham looks awkward, feeling the weight of their shared history from high school days. Meanwhile, Merrill is in an army recruitment center, where enlistment interest has spiked recently, looking at posters featuring various branches of the military, and a gray-haired man in a sergeant's uniform sits at a desk with a poster of Uncle Sam behind him, a classic recruitment image dating back to World War I. Merrill turns to the sergeant, and Cunningham, who has served three tours overseas, stares up at Merrill. Merrill gazes apprehensively down at Cunningham, then laughs, breaking the tension. Cunningham gives Merrill a pamphlet, detailing enlistment benefits, and Merrill stares at Cunningham, then nods, contemplating a new direction in life. A scruffy young man is filling out a form, looking slightly out of place amidst the disciplined environment. Lionel smirks, with stubble on his chin and wearing a t-shirt and sleeveless biker jacket, a sign of his rebellious nature. Merrill folds up the pamphlet and puts it in his pocket, then walks solemnly towards the door. He stops just behind Lionel and jerks as though about to hit him, causing Lionel to flinch, and then Merrill leaves, the encounter leaving an impression on both. In the bookshop, Bo sits at a table and sips a glass of water as a cola commercial comes on TV, touting a refreshing new flavor. Morgan holds the book out to the lady, proud of his choice. Meanwhile, in the pharmacy, Tracy thinks about her plans for a weekend getaway. Merrill, Morgan, and Bo are already eating in a pizza restaurant, one renowned in the area for its gourmet toppings, when Graham comes in and sits at their table. The other three nod, and Graham sighs and nods back, then glances out of the restaurant doorway. His expression hardens when he sees a young dark-haired man of Asian descent, often seen in the neighborhood driving his brown Chevrolet four by four, strolling down the sidewalk and opening the back door of the truck. Morgan follows his father's gaze and looks out of the doorway at the man, an unfamiliar tension building, and Merrill also gazes out at the young man. Graham and his family stare fixedly out at the young man, who shuts his car door and glances over at the restaurant, seeing the family gazing back at him with unspoken questions. His mouth opens in surprise as Graham takes a deep breath, recalling a past encounter. The young man looks unsettled as he gets into his driver's seat, fires up the engine, and the four by four swings out of its parking bay and accelerates off down the road, leaving behind a sense of unresolved mystery. Graham turns back to the table and takes a bite of pizza, enjoying the rich flavor, while Merrill, Morgan, and Bo continue looking out at the street, lost in their thoughts.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Graham's silver station wagon drives along the freeway and passes a large modern church. The station wagon parks beside other vehicles outside a parade of shops and the family gets out. Merrill feeds the parking meter and Morgan holds his hand out to Graham. Graham hands Morgan some cash and Morgan and Bo head off down the sidewalk together. Graham watches them as Morgan holds out his hand and Bo takes it. Graham turns and calls to Merrill who strolls off in the other direction. Morgan is in a bookshop watching the news coverage with the middleaged proprietors while Graham waits at the counter in a pharmacy listening to a radio. The young shop assistant comes to the counter with a paper prescription bag and leans pensively on the counter. Tracy's face crumples and Graham looks awkward. Meanwhile Merrill is in an army recruitment center looking at posters where a grayhaired man in a sergeant's uniform sits at a desk with a poster of Uncle Sam behind him. Merrill turns to the sergeant and Cunningham stares up at Merrill. Merrill gazes apprehensively down at Cunningham then laughs. Cunningham gives Merrill a pamphlet and Merrill stares at. Cunningham then nods. A scruffy young man is filling out a form. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. Lionel smirks with stubble on his chin and wearing a tshirt and sleeveless biker jacket. Merrill folds up the pamphlet and puts it in his pocket then walks solemnly towards the door. He stops just behind Lionel and jerks as though about to hit him causing Lionel to flinch and then Merrill leaves. In the bookshop Bo sits at a table and sips a glass of water. as a cola commercial comes on TV. Morgan holds the book out to the lady. Meanwhile in the pharmacy Tracy thinks Merrill. Morgan and Bo are already eating in a pizza restaurant when Graham comes in and sits at their table. The other three nod and Graham sighs and nods back then glances out of the restaurant doorway. His expression hardens when he sees a young darkhaired man of Asian descent strolling down the sidewalk and opening the back door of a brown Chevrolet four by four. Morgan follows his father's gaze and looks out of the doorway at the man and Merrill also gazes out at the young man. Graham and his family stare fixedly out at the young man who shuts his car door and glances over at the restaurant seeing the family gazing back at him. His mouth opens in surprise as Graham takes a deep breath. The young man looks unsettled as he gets into his driver's seat fires up the engine and the four by four swings out of its parking bay and accelerates off down the road. Graham turns back to the table and takes a bite of pizza while Merrill. Morgan and Bo continue looking out at the street.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Molly's silver station wagon drives along the freeway and passes a large modern church. The station wagon parks beside other vehicles outside a parade of shops, and the band gets out. Terrence feeds the parking meter, and Lily holds her hand out to Molly. Molly hands Lily some cash, and Lily and Sam head off down the sidewalk together. Molly watches them as Lily holds out her hand and Sam takes it. Molly turns and calls to Terrence, who strolls off in the other direction. Lily is in a bookshop watching the news coverage with the middle-aged proprietors, while Molly waits at the counter in a pharmacy listening to a radio. The young shop assistant comes to the counter with a paper prescription bag and leans pensively on the counter. Rebecca's face crumples, and Molly looks awkward. Meanwhile, Terrence is in an army recruitment center looking at posters where a gray-haired man in a sergeant's uniform sits at a desk with a poster of Uncle Sam behind him. Terrence turns to the sergeant, and Harrison stares up at Terrence. Terrence gazes apprehensively down at Harrison, then laughs. Harrison gives Terrence a pamphlet, and Terrence stares at Harrison, then nods. A scruffy young woman is filling out a form. Vanessa smirks, with stubble on her chin and wearing a t-shirt and sleeveless biker jacket. Terrence folds up the pamphlet and puts it in his pocket, then walks solemnly towards the door. She stops just behind Vanessa and jerks as though about to hit her, causing Vanessa to flinch, and then Terrence leaves. In the bookshop, Sam sits at a table and sips a glass of water as a cola commercial comes on TV. Lily holds the book out to the gentleman. Meanwhile, in the pharmacy, Rebecca thinks. Terrence, Lily, and Sam are already eating in a pizza restaurant when Molly comes in and sits at their table. The other three nod, and Molly sighs and nods back, then glances out of the restaurant doorway. Her expression hardens when she sees a young dark-haired woman of Asian descent strolling down the sidewalk and opening the back door of a brown Chevrolet four by four. Lily follows her mother's gaze and looks out of the doorway at the woman, and Terrence also gazes out at the young woman. Molly and her band stare fixedly out at the young woman, who shuts her car door and glances over at the restaurant, seeing the band gazing back at her. Her mouth opens in surprise as Molly takes a deep breath. The young woman looks unsettled as she gets into her driver's seat, fires up the engine, and the four by four swings out of its parking bay and accelerates off down the road. Molly turns back to the table and takes a bite of pizza, while Terrence, Lily, and Sam continue looking out at the street.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Graham's golden minivan drives along the highway and passes a large modern museum. The minivan parks beside other bicycles outside a row of cottages, and the family gets out. Merrill feeds the ticket machine, and Morgan holds his hand out to Graham. Graham hands Morgan some coins, and Morgan and Bo head off down the trail together. Graham watches them as Morgan holds out his hand and Bo takes it. Graham turns and calls to Merrill, who strolls off in the other direction. Morgan is in a candy store watching the news coverage with the middle-aged collectors, while Graham waits at the counter in an electronics store listening to a podcast. The young shop assistant comes to the counter with a plastic prescription cup and leans pensively on the counter. Tracy's face crumples, and Graham looks awkward. Meanwhile, Merrill is in a police station looking at brochures where a gray-haired man in a detective's uniform sits at a desk with a poster of Lady Liberty behind him. Merrill turns to the detective, and Cunningham stares up at Merrill. Merrill gazes apprehensively down at Cunningham, then laughs. Cunningham gives Merrill a brochure, and Merrill stares at Cunningham, then nods. A scruffy young man is filling out a survey. Lionel smirks, with stubble on his chin and wearing a tank top and sleeveless vest. Merrill folds up the brochure and puts it in his pocket, then walks solemnly towards the exit. He stops just behind Lionel and jerks as though about to poke him, causing Lionel to flinch, and then Merrill leaves. In the candy store, Bo sits at a table and sips a glass of milk as a juice commercial comes on TV. Morgan holds the magazine out to the lady. Meanwhile, in the electronics store, Tracy thinks. Merrill, Morgan, and Bo are already eating in a burger joint when Graham comes in and sits at their table. The other three nod, and Graham sighs and nods back, then glances out of the joint doorway. His expression hardens when he sees a young dark-haired man of European descent strolling down the trail and opening the back door of a white Toyota convertible. Morgan follows his father's gaze and looks out of the doorway at the man, and Merrill also gazes out at the young man. Graham and his family stare fixedly out at the young man, who shuts his vehicle door and glances over at the joint, seeing the family gazing back at him. His mouth opens in surprise as Graham takes a deep breath. The young man looks unsettled as he gets into his driver's seat, fires up the engine, and the convertible swings out of its parking spot and accelerates off down the boulevard. Graham turns back to the table and takes a bite of burger, while Merrill, Morgan, and Bo continue looking out at the street.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Graham's silver station wagon cruises along the freeway and bypasses a large modern church. The station wagon rests beside other vehicles outside a parade of shops, and the family climbs out. Merrill inspects the parking meter, and Morgan reaches his hand toward Graham. Graham grants Morgan some cash, and Morgan and Bo wander off down the sidewalk together. Graham observes them as Morgan waves his hand and Bo grips it. Graham pivots and shouts to Merrill, who meanders off in the other direction. Morgan is in a bookshop observing the news coverage with the middle-aged proprietors, while Graham sits at the counter in a pharmacy humming to a radio. The young shop assistant approaches the counter with a paper prescription bag and lounges pensively on the counter. Tracy's face twists, and Graham feels awkward. Meanwhile, Merrill is in an army recruitment center examining posters where a gray-haired man in a sergeant's uniform relaxes at a desk with a poster of Uncle Sam behind him. Merrill faces the sergeant, and Cunningham looks up at Merrill. Merrill peers apprehensively down at Cunningham, then chuckles. Cunningham shows Merrill a pamphlet, and Merrill examines Cunningham, then agrees. A scruffy young man writes out a form. Lionel grins, with stubble on his chin and wearing a t-shirt and sleeveless biker jacket. Merrill crumples up the pamphlet and drops it in his pocket, then strides solemnly towards the door. He pauses just behind Lionel and flinches as though about to embrace him, causing Lionel to twitch, and then Merrill exits. In the bookshop, Bo sits at a table and gulps a glass of water as a cola commercial airs on TV. Morgan extends the book to the lady. Meanwhile, in the pharmacy, Tracy muses. Merrill, Morgan, and Bo are already sipping drinks in a pizza restaurant when Graham enters and settles at their table. The other three acknowledge, and Graham exhales and acknowledges back, then peers out of the restaurant doorway. His expression intensifies when he notices a young dark-haired man of Asian descent meandering down the sidewalk and unlatching the back door of a brown Chevrolet four by four. Morgan imitates his father's gaze and peeks out of the doorway at the man, and Merrill also peers out at the young man. Graham and his family fix their gazes out at the young man, who closes his car door and glances over at the restaurant, catching the family staring back at him. His mouth widens in surprise as Graham inhales deeply. The young man appears startled as he settles into his driver's seat, activates the engine, and the four by four glides out of its parking bay and speeds off down the road. Graham swivels back to the table and nibbles on a piece of pizza, while Merrill, Morgan, and Bo persist in looking out at the street.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Randall's golden hot air balloon floats over the canyon and passes a small vintage lighthouse. The hot air balloon lands among other tents outside a string of amusement parks, and the orchestra gets out. Tiffany waters the rose bush, and Oliver holds his hand out to Randall. Randall hands Oliver some beads, and Oliver and Lou skip off down the trail together. Randall watches them as Oliver holds out his hand and Lou grabs it. Randall turns and calls to Tiffany, who wanders off in the opposite direction. Oliver is in a candy shop watching the cooking channel with the young sailors, while Randall waits at the register in a bakery listening to a podcast. The old librarian comes to the register with a silk scarf and leans casually on the counter. Jamie's face brightens, and Randall looks pleased. Meanwhile, Tiffany is in a dance academy looking at paintings where a bald woman in a dancer's costume sits at a desk with a photograph of Fred Astaire behind her. Tiffany turns to the dancer, and Lincoln stares up at Tiffany. Tiffany gazes curiously down at Lincoln, then giggles. Lincoln gives Tiffany a postcard, and Tiffany stares at Lincoln, then smiles. A neat old woman is filling out a notebook. Pauline frowns, wearing glasses and a wool coat. Tiffany folds up the postcard and puts it in her purse, then walks cheerfully towards the exit. She stops just behind Pauline and jumps as though about to hug her, causing Pauline to shiver, and then Tiffany departs. In the candy shop, Lou sits at a counter and sips a cup of tea as a sports ad comes on TV. Oliver holds the map out to the gentleman. Meanwhile, in the bakery, Jamie laughs. Tiffany, Oliver, and Lou are already dancing in a ballroom when Randall arrives and stands at their side. The others nod, and Randall chuckles and nods back, then gazes out of the ballroom window. His expression softens when he sees a young blonde girl of Native American descent riding down the trail and opening the hatch of a turquoise Mustang coupe. Oliver follows his uncle's gaze and peers out of the window at the girl, and Tiffany also gazes out at the young girl. Randall and his orchestra stare excitedly out at the young girl, who closes her trunk and glances over at the ballroom, seeing the orchestra glancing back at her. Her eyes widen in amazement as Randall exhales deeply. The young girl looks pleased as she climbs into her passenger seat, starts up the engine, and the coupe zooms out of its resting spot and speeds off down the lane. Randall turns back to the side and sips some lemonade, while Tiffany, Oliver, and Lou continue peering out at the trail.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Carla's bronze compact sedan cruises along the highway and overtakes a small vintage library. The compact sedan halts beside other vehicles outside a row of bistros, and the group steps out. Wesley counts the parking meter coins, and Jamie holds his hand out to Carla. Carla passes Jamie some coupons, and Jamie and Lee wander off down the sidewalk together. Carla observes them as Jamie stretches out his hand and Lee grasps it. Carla turns and shouts to Wesley, who wanders off in the opposite direction. Jamie is in a cafe watching the weather update with the elderly patrons, while Carla stands at the counter in a bakery listening to a podcast. The teenage cashier approaches the counter with a cake box and leans casually on the counter. Sara's face lights up, and Carla looks confused. Meanwhile, Wesley is in a travel agency inspecting brochures where a bald man in a pilot's uniform sits at a desk with a map of Europe behind him. Wesley turns to the pilot, and Wilson stares up at Wesley. Wesley gazes curiously down at Wilson, then chuckles. Wilson hands Wesley a brochure, and Wesley stares at Wilson, then smiles. A clean-shaven young woman is filling out a survey. Olivia beams, with freckles on her cheeks and wearing a hoodie and cargo shorts. Wesley folds up the brochure and places it in his backpack, then strides cheerfully towards the exit. He pauses just behind Olivia and nudges as if to tap her, causing Olivia to startle, and then Wesley exits. In the cafe, Lee sits at a counter and nibbles a biscuit as a juice commercial plays on TV. Jamie hands the book to the gentleman. Meanwhile, in the bakery, Sara ponders. Wesley, Jamie, and Lee are already dining in a sushi restaurant when Carla enters and joins their table. The other three smile, and Carla exhales and smiles back, then glances out of the restaurant window. Her gaze sharpens when she notices a young fair-haired woman of European descent wandering down the sidewalk and opening the back door of a green Ford pickup truck. Jamie follows his mother's gaze and peers out of the window at the woman, and Wesley also peers out at the young woman. Carla and her friends watch intently out at the young woman, who shuts her truck door and glances over at the restaurant, noticing the group peering back at her. Her eyes widen in surprise as Carla exhales deeply. The young woman looks perplexed as she slips into her passenger seat, starts up the ignition, and the pickup truck pulls out of its parking space and zooms off down the street. Carla turns back to the table and takes a sip of soda, while Wesley, Jamie, and Lee continue watching the street.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Graham's bronze bicycle rolls down the railway and glides past a towering antique library. The bicycle halts next to a cluster of motorcycles outside a series of stalls, and the family dismounts. Merrill waters the streetlamp, and Morgan stretches his arm out to Graham. Graham tosses Morgan some marbles, and Morgan and Bo wander off down the pathway together. Graham observes them as Morgan stretches out his arm and Bo grabs it. Graham pivots and shouts to Merrill, who saunters off in the opposite direction. Morgan is in a laundromat observing sports highlights with the middle-aged patrons, while Graham stands at the counter in a bakery eavesdropping on a podcast. The young baker approaches the counter with a loaf of bread and leans playfully on the counter. Tracy's face brightens, and Graham looks pleased. Meanwhile, Merrill is in a music shop examining records where a gray-haired man in a magician's outfit sits at an easel with a poster of a famous DJ behind him. Merrill turns to the magician, and Cunningham peers up at Merrill. Merrill gazes curiously down at Cunningham, then giggles. Cunningham hands Merrill a record, and Merrill peers at Cunningham, then grins. A scruffy young man is sketching a picture. Lionel grins, with ink on his hands and wearing a sweater and puffy vest. Merrill rolls up the record and slides it in his satchel, then strides flamboyantly towards the exit. He halts just behind Lionel and twitches as if about to prank him, causing Lionel to jump, and then Merrill departs. In the laundromat, Bo rests at a counter and munches a slice of bread as a juice ad airs on TV. Morgan extends the shirt out to the attendant. Meanwhile, in the bakery, Tracy daydreams. Merrill, Morgan, and Bo are already browsing in a bookstore when Graham enters and browses at their table. The other three nod, and Graham exhales and nods back, then peeks out of the bookstore window. His expression intensifies when he notices a young dark-haired man of Asian descent ambling down the pathway and unlocking the back door of a green Volkswagen convertible. Morgan follows his father's gaze and peers out of the window at the man, and Merrill also peers out at the young man. Graham and his family gaze intently out at the young man, who closes his car door and glances over at the bookstore, noticing the family observing him. His eyes widen in astonishment as Graham inhales deeply. The young man looks puzzled as he climbs into his passenger seat, pedals up the engine, and the convertible charges out of its parking spot and zooms off down the lane. Graham turns back to the table and takes a sip of lemonade, while Merrill, Morgan, and Bo continue peering out at the avenue.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Oliver's golden canoe paddles along the river and drifts past a towering ancient fortress. The canoe anchors beside other boats outside a series of markets, and the group climbs out. Emily waters the garden gnome, and Liam extends his claw to Oliver. Oliver tosses Liam some berries, and Liam and Zoe saunter down the trail together. Oliver observes them as Liam extends his claw and Zoe grips it. Oliver rotates and shouts to Emily, who meanders off in the opposite direction. Liam is in a library examining the weather forecasts with the elderly librarians, while Oliver lingers at the register in a grocery store humming to a melody. The teenage cashier arrives at the register with a plastic candy wrapper and reclines thoughtfully on the register. Nancy's expression droops, and Oliver fidgets uneasily. Meanwhile, Emily is in a circus tent admiring clowns where a bald man in a ringmaster's outfit reclines on a bench with a portrait of a lion behind him. Emily turns to the ringmaster, and Harrison glances up at Emily. Emily gazes nervously down at Harrison, then giggles. Harrison hands Emily a leaflet, and Emily gawks at Harrison, then grins. A scruffy young woman is scribbling on a napkin. Trevor snickers, with a patchy beard and wearing a sweatshirt and denim vest. Emily folds the leaflet and slides it into her bag, then strides solemnly towards the exit. She halts just behind Trevor and jostles as though about to trip him, causing Trevor to gasp, and then Emily exits. In the library, Zoe perches at a desk and sips a cup of tea as a fruit juice commercial airs on the radio. Liam hoists the magazine towards the librarian. Meanwhile, in the grocery store, Nancy ponders. Emily, Liam, and Zoe are already munching in a sushi bar when Oliver arrives and settles at their booth. The other three grin, and Oliver huffs and grins back, then peers out of the sushi bar entryway. His expression tightens when he spots a young blond-haired woman of European heritage skipping down the path and unlocking the front door of a gold Toyota sedan. Liam follows his guardian's look and peers out of the entryway at the woman, and Emily also peers out at the young woman. Oliver and his companions fixate on the young woman, who locks her car door and peeks over at the sushi bar, noticing the group staring back at her. Her eyes widen in shock as Oliver inhales deeply. The young woman appears uneasy as she settles into her driver's seat, turns on the motor, and the sedan glides out of its mooring site and races off down the avenue. Oliver swivels back to the booth and nibbles a piece of sushi, while Emily, Liam, and Zoe persist in gazing out at the path.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Graham's family arrives in a silver station wagon at a shopping area. Merrill feeds the parking meter, and Graham gives Morgan cash to head down the sidewalk with Bo. Graham observes them before calling Merrill, who walks in the opposite direction. Morgan watches news coverage in a bookshop, while Graham listens to a radio in a pharmacy. Merrill visits an army recruitment center, engages briefly with a sergeant named Cunningham, and leaves after teasing a young man named Lionel. In the bookshop, Bo drinks water while Morgan interacts with a lady. The family, including Graham, later gathers at a pizza restaurant. Graham notices a young Asian man outside, prompting a shared stare from the family. The man, surprised, gets into his vehicle and leaves. Graham returns to eating his pizza, while the others continue gazing outside.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Morgan and Bo continue looking out at the street Graham turns back to the table and takes a bite of pizza while Merrill The young man looks unsettled as he gets into his driver's seat fires up the engine and the four by four swings out of its parking bay and accelerates off down the road His mouth opens in surprise as Graham takes a deep breath Graham and his family stare fixedly out at the young man who shuts his car door and glances over at the restaurant seeing the family gazing back at him Morgan follows his father's gaze and looks out of the doorway at the man and Merrill also gazes out at the young man His expression hardens when he sees a young darkhaired man of Asian descent strolling down the sidewalk and opening the back door of a brown Chevrolet four by four The other three nod and Graham sighs and nods back then glances out of the restaurant doorway Morgan and Bo are already eating in a pizza restaurant when Graham comes in and sits at their table Meanwhile in the pharmacy Tracy thinks Merrill Morgan holds the book out to the lady as a cola commercial comes on TV In the bookshop Bo sits at a table and sips a glass of water He stops just behind Lionel and jerks as though about to hit him causing Lionel to flinch and then Merrill leaves Merrill folds up the pamphlet and puts it in his pocket then walks solemnly towards the door Lionel smirks with stubble on his chin and wearing a tshirt and sleeveless biker jacket A scruffy young man is filling out a form Cunningham then nods Cunningham gives Merrill a pamphlet and Merrill stares at Merrill gazes apprehensively down at Cunningham then laughs Merrill turns to the sergeant and Cunningham stares up at Merrill Meanwhile Merrill is in an army recruitment center looking at posters where a grayhaired man in a sergeant's uniform sits at a desk with a poster of Uncle Sam behind him Tracy's face crumples and Graham looks awkward The young shop assistant comes to the counter with a paper prescription bag and leans pensively on the counter Morgan is in a bookshop watching the news coverage with the middleaged proprietors while Graham waits at the counter in a pharmacy listening to a radio Graham turns and calls to Merrill who strolls off in the other direction Graham watches them as Morgan holds out his hand and Bo takes it Graham hands Morgan some cash and Morgan and Bo head off down the sidewalk together Merrill feeds the parking meter and Morgan holds his hand out to Graham The station wagon parks beside other vehicles outside a parade of shops and the family gets out Graham's silver station wagon drives along the freeway and passes a large modern church
